channel.title: Mouse Detection Class
channel.description:
I thought i'd be nice and post what it is, in the current deob.
[b]Class17[/b]
Not alot of use, but some may find it intresting.

item.title: Mouse Detection Class
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

oh i see you, ya they split and join the mouse thread. Nah the mouse thread just streams moiuse x,y 's from the client to the server. Why would you ever need to find that thou? sure it was feasible to just send it false x, y instead of fake events. But now they have counters on every listener.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Detection Class
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

@ruler: That’s not it. The static factors of the MouseLogger class are:

  • implements Runnable
  • contains an Object used for synchronization with the client thread
  • contains two int arrays which store mouse coordinates when your account is flagged

w.a could be one of their method call counters (on mouseMoved, presumably).

You really shouldn’t ever need to hack it though. There hasn’t been any work done on this theory (that I know of), but I assume that if your MouseLogger record ever fails to match your game actions on the server then you will be banned.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Detection Class
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Taios:

Not alot of use, but some may find it intresting.

I have said its not overly useful but it good to work out how the mouse detection works. For example, they only start the detection when you login. Its not started at the login screen.

Read full topic

White correct its not useful bc i already have a solution. This is just anouther solution i have found.

i EDITTED the pirint above to show the methods for you all

item.description:

item.title: Mouse Detection Class
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Ruler, the current deob names it that. Now, you can look for a class the imports the FontMetrics class and implements Runnable. Or, find something else unique to it fo find it without it being renamed.
